moves.3... Nxd5 4. c4: I decided on Nf3, leaving a gambit unprotected for a bit of tempo connected with double move of black knight
moves.4... Nf6 5. d4 g6 6. d5 Bg7 7. Bd3 O-O: white pawn chain is a bit streached, to prevent Nc6. Passive Bd3 was thought to be active after being ganged up with queen and ramming black kings' side with a knight or/and a pawn
moves.8. O-O b6 9. Bg5 Bb7 10. Nc3 c6: This is a moment when development is finished and sloughter is to begin
moves.11. Bxf6 Bxf6 12. Be4 Bxc3 13. bxc3 Qd6: After exchange of light figures black plans to overpower d5 pawn
moves.18... Qxb5 19. Qxb5 Bxe4: queen for a rock and a bishop. White has 2 week isolated pawns. Material is even and black is looking much better. My idea at this point is to make some air near black king what would enable white queen to fork some material gains or draw with never ending checks (what's a legimit name for it?)
moves.20. Qb3 e6 21. f3 Bb7 22. c4 Na6 23. Rc1: I'm putting my self in terrible fork on d4.
moves.25... f6 26. Nxg6: An attempt to open  king side
moves.26... Nd3+: declined. imho, not the best choice for black becouse...
moves.27. Kg3 Nxc1 28. Ne7+ Kg7 29. Nxc8 Nd3 3: ... this combination lead to  2 for white
moves.31... Ba6 32. h4 Rc8 33. Nd4 Bxc4 34. Qb: my poor play lead to even material and black positional advantage due to a passing pawn on B6
moves.38. Qd7+ Kg6 39. Nxe6 Bxe6 40. Qxe6 b5 4: passing pawn is advancing, yet f5 check (called as alsol the last hope of white) is comming
moves.42. f5+ Kh5: a terrible blunder. After g7 game was still on. White has it's eadge, but black is 3 moves from promotion
moves.43. Qf7+:
mate in one - black resigned
thanks to  hsidnevac  for a interesting game : )
